TopicTitle: Will blowing up the Administration Facility cancel your in-place strategies?

Articles.Content:
I'm playing hard career mode, have maxed out the tech tree, and therefore have no further use for my old Administration strategy of converting some funds into science. Obviously I can't go back and cancel this strategy now that it's in effect, but... it got me to thinking. Does anyone know if blowing up the Admin facility will achieve the desired effect? I'm kind of hesitant to try this in career mode without knowing if it will work.

(Maxmaps sort of hinted this might be the case on his big Twitch 0.25 reveal a couple weeks ago... but it wasn't clear if he was just joking around or not.)

Edited October 13, 2014 by Yakky

Well if you want to test it, just make a new game, start a stratagy, and blow up the building.

It'll take like 10 minutes

I don't think it'll cancel your strategy, but you won't be able to switch them without the building.

~Claw

Obviously I can't go back and cancel this strategy now that it's in effect,

Forgive me if I'm wrong (as I'm not at my home pc at the moment to confirm) but I could have sworn you can cancel the strategies - I'm sure I noticed a cancel button when you clicked on an active one ... :/

Yes, you can cancel a running strategy, assuming the building is fine. You can't modify it once it's running unless you cancel it and restart it, which means an all new startup cost. I have no idea what effect destroying the building has on existing strategies.

I didn't realize I could cancel in-place strategies. I got enough stern warning dialog boxes about the strategies being permanent that I didn't even bother to look for a "cancel" button. Oh well, you know what they say about assuming...

Thanks for the tip BTW.
